metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16838 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in sssd Group Policy Objects implementation. When the GPO is not readable by SSSD due to a too strict permission settings on the server side, SSSD will allow all authenticated users to login instead of denying access.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16838` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libipa-hbac0 - 2.2.2-1
libnss-sss - 2.2.2-1
libpam-sss - 2.2.2-1
libsss-certmap0 - 2.2.2-1
libsss-idmap0 - 2.2.2-1
libsss-nss-idmap0 - 2.2.2-1
libsss-sudo - 2.2.2-1
python3-libipa-hbac - 2.2.2-1
python3-libsss-nss-idmap - 2.2.2-1
python3-sss - 2.2.2-1
sssd - 2.2.2-1
sssd-ad - 2.2.2-1
sssd-ad-common - 2.2.2-1
sssd-common - 2.2.2-1
sssd-dbus - 2.2.2-1
sssd-idp - 2.2.2-1
sssd-ipa - 2.2.2-1
sssd-kcm - 2.2.2-1
sssd-krb5 - 2.2.2-1
sssd-krb5-common - 2.2.2-1
sssd-ldap - 2.2.2-1
sssd-passkey - 2.2.2-1
sssd-proxy - 2.2.2-1
sssd-tools - 2.2.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sssd package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.2-1').
